question: Which of the following muscles is innervated by the ulnar nerve?
short_explanation: The ulnar nerve innervates the flexor carpi ulnaris in the forearm.
long_explanation: The ulnar nerve is responsible for innervating specific muscles in the forearm and hand, including the flexor carpi ulnaris and the medial half of the flexor digitorum profundus. These muscles allow for wrist flexion and ulnar deviation.
applied_example: Knowledge of ulnar nerve innervation helps therapists apply techniques that avoid nerve compression near the medial epicondyle of the elbow.
text: Which of the following muscles is innervated by the ulnar nerve?

question: Which of the following muscles is innervated by the ulnar nerve?
short_explanation: Adductor pollicis is innervated by the ulnar nerve.
long_explanation: The ulnar nerve innervates intrinsic hand muscles and parts of the forearm. Adductor pollicis is one of its motor targets, essential for fine motor control, grip strength, and finger movements.
source_reference: Trail Guide to the Body, 6th ed.
applied_example: Targeting the ulnar nerve path during massage can aid clients experiencing numbness or tingling in the 4th and 5th digits, especially in conditions like cubital tunnel syndrome involving Adductor pollicis dysfunction.
text: Which of the following muscles is innervated by the ulnar nerve?

short_explanation: Flexor digitorum profundus (medial half) is innervated by the ulnar nerve.

source_reference: Trail Guide to the Body, 6th ed.
applied_example: Targeting the ulnar nerve path during massage can aid clients experiencing numbness or tingling in the 4th and 5th digits, especially in conditions like cubital tunnel syndrome involving Flexor digitorum profundus (medial half) dysfunction.
